body_html:
There's a bug atm that it only runs on CPU.... fix coming soon!

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca

On Mon, Aug 1, 2016 at 2:56 PM, ASDen notifications@github.com wrote:

@ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo when I add an optimizer to the
graph LSTMFusedCell, it gives an error
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for *: 'NoneType' and 'int'

when I remove the optimizer and try only to perform the forward pass, it
works, but the performance (on GTX 960) is horrible, it is 10 times slower
than original LSTM (maybe it was tuned for Titan X ?)

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
There's a bug atm that it only runs on CPU.... fix coming soon!

## 

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca

> @ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo when I add an optimizer to the
> graph LSTMFusedCell, it gives an error
> TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for *: 'NoneType' and 'int'
> 
> when I remove the optimizer and try only to perform the forward pass, it
> works, but the performance (on GTX 960) is horrible, it is 10 times slower
> than original LSTM (maybe it was tuned for Titan X ?)
